subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Administrative Assistant Training
headline: Train as an administrative assistant in this free online administration course that explains how to organise an office.
description: One of the most crucial roles in every firm is that of the administrative assistant. This course teaches you all you need to know to start a career in this field. We explain how to act and behave before or after being hired and lay out the daily duties of an administrative assistant. We then cover telephone etiquette and basic filing techniques before showing you how to organise meetings and conferences and use office machinery properly.
courseDescription:
How well you manage clients and other day-to-day workplace activities can significantly impact your company's overall performance. As an administrative assistant, you must adapt quickly and effectively to a wide range of situations. In this course, we explain how to stay one step ahead of your peers and meet the challenges of this essential and rewarding role.

The administrative assistant's role is crucial to the success of any organisation. This administration training course lays out the requirements for an administrative assistant and takes you through the hiring process to provide a thorough understanding of the job. We provide interview tips to help you beat the competition. We then explore the office space and examine the supplies that administrative assistants require to do their work effectively. We also go over the etiquette of using the office phone and pay particular attention to the complications that may arise if mistakes are made.

The role of an administrative assistant often includes making sure that important company events like meetings and conferences run smoothly. We explore the ‘anatomy’ of a meeting, the types of corporate meetings and how to draft meeting agendas and minutes. We then provide various strategies used to maintain records and arrange and allocate files. The course trains you in the basics of using office equipment like telephones, computers, fax machines and so on. An administrative assistant plays a key role in organising the office and many famous names start out in this role as they learn from their colleagues. Sign up to begin your career in office administration.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain the numerous components of an administrative assistant's employment
    • Discuss the day-to-day activities of an administrative assistant
    • Recall some basic telephone and voice-mail etiquette tips 
    • Summarize how to organize an annual shareholders' meeting to elect directors
    • Distinguish between the decimal and group name filing systems

  • Meetings

  • Introduction to the Module
  • There are several training guides, manuals, certificate programs, and degree programs accessible to learn how to design meetings and events right now. On the other hand, administrative professionals may not have the time or money to enrol in certificate programs or study these comprehensive materials to rapidly begin planning a successful meeting or event for their firm. This section analyzes a survey of current meeting management training manuals accessible and used in the industry, as well as trade periodicals, with the goal of extracting common themes and fundamental tools needed to learn how to organise a meeting and event quickly and efficiently. In the appendices, there is a chart that summarises the contents of these guides.
  • Topics to be covered in this lesson

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

    • Anatomy of a Meeting
    • Types of Corporate Meetings Scheduling Meetings
    • Meeting Agendas
    • Meeting Minutes
    • Conferences
    • Summary

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
  • An administrative assistant is also known as the executive secretary, private secretary, personal secretary or office administrator. The job is one of the most vital jobs in any firm.
  • Below are some of the tenets employers focus on when recruiting an administrative secretary:
    1. Punctuality: A company needs an administrative assistant that is always on time and available throughout business hours.
    2. Consistency: A recruiter looks at the applicant's personality and temperament to see if they are trustworthy.
    3. Ability to grasp: Employers want to know about the applicant's educational background, including official programs and degrees, self-study, and single courses.
    4. Willingness to do what is asked of you: The employer is looking for someone who will attentively and voluntarily follow directions.
  • As an administrative assistant, where you conduct your day-to-day job and the environment in which you do it may have a big impact on how productive you are.
  • A minimum quantity of reference books and other sources of knowledge should be kept in every office. These are extremely useful in writing, taking dictation, and transcribing, and can help you better your job by broadening your understanding of the topics discussed in letters or reports.

    2. Consistency: A recruiter looks at the applicant's personality and temperament to see if they are trustworthy.
    3. Ability to grasp: Employers want to know about the applicant's educational background, including official programs and degrees, self-study, and single courses.
    4. Willingness to do what is asked of you: The employer is looking for someone who will attentively and voluntarily follow directions.
  • As an administrative assistant, where you conduct your day-to-day job and the environment in which you do it may have a big impact on how productive you are.
  • A minimum quantity of reference books and other sources of knowledge should be kept in every office. These are extremely useful in writing, taking dictation, and transcribing, and can help you better your job by broadening your understanding of the topics discussed in letters or reports.
